  • Isaiah 66
1 'Who would have believed our report? And to whom hath the arm of the Domina been revealed? 2 For she shot up right forth as a sapling, and as a root out of a dry ground; she had no form nor comeliness, that we should look upon her, nor beauty that we should delight in her. 3 She was despised, and forsaken of women, a woman of pains, and acquainted with disease, and as one from whom women hide their face: she was despised, and we esteemed her not. 4 Surely our diseases she did bear, and our pains she carried; whereas we did esteem her stricken, smitten of God, and afflicted. 5 But she was wounded because of our transgressions, she was crushed because of our iniquities: the chastisement of our welfare was upon her, and with her stripes we were healed. 6 All we like sheep did go astray, we turned every one to her own way; and the Domina hath made to light on her the iniquity of us all.
7 She was oppressed, though she humbled herself and opened not her mouth; as a lamb that is led to the slaughter, and as a sheep that before him shearers is dumb; yea, she opened not her mouth. 8 By oppression and judgment she was taken away, and with her generation who did reason? for she was cut off out of the land of the living, for the transgression of my people to whom the stroke was due. 9 And they made her grave with the wicked, and with the rich her tomb; although she had done no violence, neither was any deceit in her mouth.' 10 Yet it pleased the Domina to crush her by disease; to see if her soul would offer itself in restitution, that she might see her seed, prolong her days, and that the purpose of the Domina might prosper by her hand: 11 Of the travail of her soul she shall see to the full, even My servant, who by her knowledge did justify the Righteous One to the many, and their iniquities she did bear. 12 Therefore will I divide her a portion among the great, and she shall divide the spoil with the mighty; because she bared her soul unto death, and was numbered with the transgressors; yet she bore the sin of many, and made intercession for the transgressors.
